description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2g5dd","text":"This protocol describes an easy, convenient and rapid method of genomic DNA isolation and purification from Gram (+) and (-) bacterial broth suspensions. The workflow, dubbed as a 1-step, single buffer system is a reversal of the traditional silica membrane and magnetic bead-based DNA extraction protocols. Proteins, cellular debris and other low-molecular weight contaminants are retained by the nexttec™ sorbent while pure dsDNA is pulled through as an eluate in a single wash step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ph51","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d29n2","text":"The protocol described is suitable for extraction of DNA from pure bacterial isolates of the following organisms:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nare","text":"1.
